overview: This subject provides students with the experience of carrying out research independently on each of three topics chosen by the subject’s lecturers. For each topic, the student is required, over eight weeks to conduct and present as an extended essay the results of an independent piece of actuarial science research.

This subject involves a two-semester program of study. Students must enrol in two consecutive semesters,Actuarial Studies Projects - Part 1, Semester 1 and Actuarial Studies Projects - Part 2, Semester 2.

additional pre-requisite: Admission into the MC-COMACTS Master of Commerce (Actuarial Science)

assessments.description: Written Assignment 1. The word count, includes: footnotes, appendices and the number of words which would take up space used for tables, formulae and charts but excludes bibliography. 3500 words
Written Assignment 2. The word count includes: footnotes, appendices and the number of words which would take up space used for tables, formulae and charts but excludes bibliography. 4000 words

Prescribed texts: You will be advised of prescribed texts by your lecturer.
